p.span: Kansas High School (Front door by flag pole)

div.p: Meals will be delivered to your vehicle at curbside in the parking lot.Â Both meals will be delivered at that time.

The delivery routes will leave the school at 9:00a.m. and meals will be delivered to your house according to the route consisting of the closest location to the farthest location from the school.Â There are 4 different routes at this time. Both meals will be delivered in one stop.Â
***Thank you for your patience and please understand that our meal plan may change as meals are added.Â

strong.span: From Ottowas and Delaware county Health Department

span.span: The CDC has issued â€œInterim Guidance for Administrators of US Childcare Programs and K-12 Schools to Plan, Prepare, and Respond to Coronavirus Disease 2019.â€ You can find the link to that information here:Â https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/specific-groups/guidance-for-schools.htmlÂ Please also find an attached Fact Sheet issued by Oklahoma State Department of Health for distribution as you see fit on COVID-19. Schools should continue to collaborate, share information, and review plans with local health officials to help protect the whole school community, including those with special health needs. School plans should be designed to minimize disruption to teaching and learning and protect students and staff from social stigma and discrimination. Plans can build on everyday practices (e.g., encouraging hand hygiene, monitoring absenteeism, communicating routinely) that include strategies for before, during, and after a possible outbreak. Delaware County Health Department is closely monitoring the situation and will send updates if needed.
If you have additional questions, please call 405.271.4060.

strong.span: Delaware and Ottawa County Health Department
